text: - Hello, and welcome to Community Chats.

I'm Aley Hammer, and today
we're joined with Jarrett Baker,

the technical operations
manager from IPSI.
Jarrett, welcome to the show.
Can you start by telling our audience
a little bit about IPSI?
- Thanks for having me, Aley.

So here at IPSI, we specialize
in cloud payment technology.

Historically that's meant our
business and services focused

on educating and supporting
corporate and large businesses,

specifically with regards
to card data security,
compliance needs, such as PCI DSS,
whilst providing tools, services

and applications to meet
the customers' expectations,
business, and technical requirements.

Our services have been designed
to secure card processing
across numerous channels,
including standard website processing,
back office processing,

and call center agent-supported,
phone-based processing,

regardless of the bank or
acquirer they may deal with.

Our approach to consultation
and partnership in this space
has seen us work with the likes
of Latitude Financial Services,
the Australian Taxation Office,

BHP Billiton, and more
in the last 15 years.

- Wow, it's really incredible
to hear how IPSI has

achieved such huge growth
despite having to deal
with COVID over the last two years.
And Jarrett, on this topic,

how have you been able
to achieve this growth

and how has AWS actually
helped along the way?
- Very good question.

So COVID's definitely
been difficult for us

over the last two years, from
a logistical perspective,
particularly for our customers,
and a compliance perspective,

with the ever-changing
environment of working conditions.
with these changes happening in the world.
We have seen a large number

of businesses pivot more
strongly towards online payments,

whilst looking for ways to
enable their staff to work

from home whilst remaining
PCI DSS compliant.
This has created a high demand

for compliance services for
processing credit card payments
across numerous channels, especially
in the IVR and agent phone services space
where interpersonal interaction
is still continually available
in our socially-distanced world.

Fortunately for IPSI, as
our application was designed
for the cloud first, AWS has enabled us to

effectively scale and
accommodate this influx
and demand and enabled our customers to
provide more personable user experiences
to their consumers during these times.

- Well, I'm so glad you've
been able to accommodate

the influx and demand and give
your customers a much more

personable experience during
these really challenging times.

And Jarrett, you've already
actually touched on this

a little bit but can you
gimme a specific example
of how moving to the cloud has benefited

both your customers
and also your business?
- Absolutely.

So being cloud-native, IPSE
has been able to quickly

and efficiently provision
new, dedicated sets

of infrastructure for our
customers while quickly

scaling them up and down as
customer demands changes.
This has enabled us to respond quickly
to events such as the recent avalanches

and natural disasters
in Western Australia,

which saw phone line
demand increased twofold

over the normal without
any noticeable impact
to critical payment transactions

or dips in call quality
within our infrastructure.

- Wow, I wasn't expecting
you to mention the avalanche

and natural disasters
in Western Australia,
but that's such a great example.
Thank you for sharing.

And Jarrett, IPSI is servicing
highly regulated industries,

so what I wanna know is what
are some of the key benefits
that customers should know when
they're engaging with IPSI?

- So when engaging with
IPSI, customers can be sure

they're engaging with a
compliant and scalable platform
that is designed to grow as they grow.
And in addition to this,
we offer a one-stop-shop service model,
which offers multiple payment channels
and multiple bank connectivity,

further enabled by our cloud-first
designs and our approach

to implementing new
features where we strive to

provide customers with new
insights, payment options
and methods without the need to implement

or continually upgrade
integrations with our services.
Customers can be assured when engaging

with us that their payments
and consumer data is safe,
secure, and in scalable hands.

- Thanks for sharing because
honestly, I really feel

that consumers are needing
that reassurance lately

that their payments and
their data is secure
and in good hands, and, you know,
especially with all the online fraud
that's going on at the moment.
So lastly, what's next for IPSI?

Are there any future
growth areas that you guys

are focusing on or what
can we expect to see?

- At the moment, considering
our socially-distanced world,

we are focusing on improving
our phone payment channel

by adding more features and
offerings to enable businesses

of all sizes to implement
compliant telephony services
with ease within their business.
In addition to this,

we're also working to
curate our platform services

and features to address a small
and medium business market

and enable these businesses
to leverage the technology

and approaches that we
here at IPSI have developed

successfully for enterprises
in the last 15 years

for their smaller and medium
consumer business markets,

effectively enabling
mid-size businesses to enjoy

that enterprise-level
capability set at a lower cost.

- Jarrett, thank you so much
for coming on the show today.
If anyone has any questions about IPSI
or what you guys are doing,

please pop them in the
comment section below
and we'll get back to you.
Thank you so much!
